name: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere
description: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept.  Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.

element.short: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere
element.definition: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept.  Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.
